DataElement.preferredName: Person Lung Neoplasm Peripheral Involvement Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a tumor or cancer of the lung is located on or near an edge or constituting an outer boundary as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Lung Neoplasm Peripheral Involvement Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a tumor or cancer of the lung located on or near an edge or constituting an outer boundary as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Lung Neoplasm Peripheral Involvement Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Tumors or cancer of the LUNG.:On or near an edge or constituting an outer boundary; the outer area.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant, primary or metastatic neoplasm involving the lungs.  Representative examples of benign neoplasms include adenoma, papilloma, chondroma, and endobronchial lipoma.  Representative examples of malignant neoplasms include carcinoma, carcinoid tumor, sarcoma, and lymphoma.
On or near an edge or constituting an outer boundary; the outer area.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
